intro: Galinsoga boliviensis, commonly known as Bolivian gallant, is an annual herbaceous plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its small, daisy-like flowers and hairy stems. The plant typically grows in disturbed soils and can be found in grasslands and along roadsides. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often covered with fine hairs. Galinsoga boliviensis is known for its rapid growth and ability to thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
